definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: Jehoshaphat became more and more powerful; he built forts and store cities in Judah
sentences.chinese: 约沙法日渐强大，在犹大建造营寨和积货城。

sentences.english: Ly Pao holds one of the group's children.
sentences.chinese: 鲍立抱着营寨中的一个孩子合影留念。

sentences.english: And all their cities, and their villages, and castles, they burned.
sentences.chinese: 火烧了他们所住的一切城邑和营寨。

sentences.english: I say, John, I see the smoke of the redskin camp!
sentences.chinese: 约翰，我看见印第安人营寨里冒出的烟了。

sentences.english: Hmong girls return to camp after doing chores at the local water source.
sentences.chinese: 苗族少女在附近的水源地做完家务事后返回营寨。

sentences.english: Foreigners lost heart and came trembling out of their fortresses.
sentences.chinese: 外邦人要衰残，战战兢兢地出他们的营寨。

sentences.english: These camps and roadblocks are the checkpoints of violence.
sentences.chinese: 这些营寨和障碍是暴利检查站。

sentences.english: He built towns in the Judean hills and forts and towers in the wooded areas.
sentences.chinese: 又在犹大山地建造城邑，在树林中建筑营寨和高楼。

sentences.english: And Jehoshaphat grew steadily greater. He built in Judah fortresses and store cities.
sentences.chinese: 约沙法日渐强大，在犹大建造营寨和积货城。

definition: Yingpan, common place name ("army camp")/place near Jintian village 金田村[Jin1 tian2 cun1] in Guangxi where the Taiping Tianguo rebels took their oaths in 1851/place in Xinfeng county 新豐縣|新丰县[Xin1 feng1 Xian4] traditional camping place of brigands/Yingpan township, place name/Yingpan in Shangluo prefecture, Shaanxi/Yingpan township in Yunnan/(many others)
to camp/to pitch camp/stationed/quartered/Taiwan pr. [zha2 ying2]
